availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John W. Cardwell (Breathitt County, Kentucky, coal miner, farmer, and postmaster.)

body.p: Breathitt County, Kentucky, coal miner, farmer, and postmaster. Knox County, Kentucky, native. Married to Celia South Cardwell. Father of Elvora Cardwell, Blackstone Cardwell, [Unknown] Cardwell, Edwin Cardwell, and John J. Cardwell. Coal miner in Breathitt County, Kentucky, in 1850. Postmaster for Jackson in Breathitt County from October 29, 1853, to December 24, 1859. Farmer and coal miner in Breathitt County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Breathitt County, District 1, p. 24B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Breathitt County, District 1, p. 387.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Breathitt County, Precinct 1, p. 386A.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 21816.
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971, Records of the Post Office Department, NARA Series M841, RG 28, Breathitt County, Kentucky, vol. 14, p. 568.
"John Watkins Cardwell (1824-1913)," Find A Grave, Memorial 40468094, accessed May 30, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/40468094.
